intro: Psychotria serpens, commonly known as the serpentine Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, capsule that contains numerous seeds. Psychotria serpens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
